headline: Curried Rice
name: Curried Rice
recipeInstructions: In a large pot over medium heat, melt ghee. Add curry leaves and fry until translucent and crispy, then remove and set aside.  Add to pot most of the onion, reserving ¼ cup for topping, and let cook until semi-translucent, about 4 minutes. Add garlic and ginger and stir until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add spices and salt and cook, stirring frequently, until onions start to caramelize, about 4 minutes more.  Add rice and stir constantly until grains are toasted, 3 to 4 minutes. Stir in broth, bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and cover. Simmer until rice is tender, about 17 minutes minutes.  Remove from heat, and let covered pot stand for 5 minutes before removing the lid. Fluff rice gently with a fork, then fold in peas. Top each serving with cashews, fresh chile, the remaining red onions, cilantro, crispy curry leaves, and yogurt before serving.

video.description: This version of curry rice is a sort of pilaf: rice is toasted in aromatic butter before being steamed to perfection. Perfectly spiced, it makes for a solid side dish, or a filling main.
video.name: Perfectly Spiced Curried Rice Is A Golden Feast

review.reviewBody: I did this with leftover jasmine rice and it was amazing! I didn't have all of the ingredients, so I just used what I had. Only thing I left out was the chicken broth since I had already cooked the rice. I left out the curry leaves which I didn't have. I cheated a bit and used garlic powder instead of minced garlic and used ground ginger instead of fresh. I topped the rice with yogurt and cilantro. Can't wait to try this using the broth.

description: For lovers of curry flavors, this curried rice will hit the spot: garlicky, buttery, well-spiced but not too spicy. To serve as a side or main, dollop with yogurt and top with toasted cashews and fried curry leaves.
